resources.string: Doman: stages of motor skills development

string-array.name: physical_mobility_stages
string-array.item: Does the child move their arms and legs without moving their body?
Does the child crawl on their stomach face down, moving to cross-crawling (when the right foot moves together with the left arm and vice versa, creating clear and synchronized movements)?
Does the child crawl on arms and knees moving to cross-crawling on all fours (when arms and legs are synchronized)?
Does the child walk around with their arms lifted up to shoulders or higher for balance?
Does the child walk around with their arms hanging loose without using them for balance?
Can the child cross-walk or run without difficulty?
Can the child balance on one leg or play with a ball hitting it with their leg?

string-array.name: physical_speech_stages
string-array.item: Does the newborn scream and cry?
Does the child cry in response to danger or threat?
Does the child audibly express their needs, e.g. wanting to eat, drink or sleep?
Does the child use two words (consciously or spontaneously)?
Does the child use 10 to 25 words and two-word phrases?
Does the child use about 2000 words and short sentences?
Does the child have an extensive vocabulary and structure sentences correctly (considering their age)?

string-array.name: physical_manual_stages
string-array.item: Does the child grab (squeeze) an item when you put it in their palm?
Can the child let go of a dangerous item? Does the child loosen the grip if the item is cold, hot or prickly?
Can the child lift an item with either hand? In this case the child often uses four fingers pressed against their palm without using the thumb.
Can the child lift items by picking them with the thumb and the index finger of one hand (like crumps from a surface)?
Can the child lift items by picking them with the thumb and the index finger of both hands?
Does the child have full command of both hands (can unscrew a bottle or a jar cap) with one hand being dominant?
Can the child write on their own (using the dominant hand)?
